snippet: Physicists say they have found a bump in their data that might be the Higgs boson, a hypothesized particle that is responsible for endowing other elementary particles with mass.
abstract: Physicists from the Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory say they have found a bump in their data that might indicate the long-sought Higgs boson, a hypothesized particle that is responsible for endowing other elementary particles with mass; announcement is a significant milestone in the 40-year search for the Higgs, one of the major objectives of contemporary physics.
lead_paragraph: Physicists say they have found a bump in their data that might be the Higgs boson, a hypothesized particle that is responsible for endowing other elementary particles with mass.

headline.seo: Higgs Boson May Be Indicated in New Data
headline.main: Data Hint at Hypothetical Particle, Key to Mass in the Universe
headline.print_headline: Data Hint at Hypothetical Particle, Key to Mass in the Universe
